articles.headline: No Keyboard? And You Call This a BlackBerry?
articles.snippet: The first sign of trouble for the new BlackBerry Storm was the concept: a touchscreen BlackBerry.
articles.abstract: The first sign of trouble for the new BlackBerry Storm was the concept: a touchscreen BlackBerry.
articles.lead_paragraph: Research in Motion (R.I.M.), the company that brought us the BlackBerry, has been on a roll lately. For a couple of years now, it’s delivered a series of gorgeous, functional, supremely reliable smartphones that, to this day, outsell even the much-adored iPhone.

articles.headline: Solvency Issues May Jeopardize Bell Canada Deal
articles.snippet: Bell Canada, the largest phone company in Canada, said the economic slump might prevent its takeover from closing on time, signaling the buyout might collapse.
articles.abstract: Bell Canada, the largest phone company in Canada, said the economic slump might prevent its takeover from closing on time, signaling the buyout might collapse.
articles.lead_paragraph: OTTAWA  The $50 billion privatization of Bell Canada, Canada’s largest telecommunications company, was in jeopardy Wednesday after accountants said that they were unable to conclude if the leveraged buyout would leave the company solvent.

articles.headline: Nationalism of Putin’s Era Veils Sins of Stalin’s
articles.snippet: The Kremlin in the Putin era has stoked a nationalism that glorifies Soviet triumphs while playing down or even whitewashing the system’s horrors.
articles.abstract: The Kremlin in the Putin era has stoked a nationalism that glorifies Soviet triumphs while playing down or even whitewashing the system’s horrors.
articles.lead_paragraph: TOMSK, Russia  For years, the earth in this Siberian city had been giving up clues: a scrap of clothing, a fragment of bone, a skull with a bullet hole.

articles.headline: At Least 100 Dead in India Terror Attacks
articles.snippet: The coordinated attacks, which were particularly brazen, struck at least two five-star hotels, the city’s largest train station, a movie theater and a hospital.
articles.abstract: The coordinated attacks, which were particularly brazen, struck at least two five-star hotels, the city’s largest train station, a movie theater and a hospital.
articles.lead_paragraph: MUMBAI, India  Coordinated terrorist attacks struck the heart of Mumbai, India’s commercial capital, on Wednesday night, killing dozens in machine-gun and grenade assaults on at least two five-star hotels, the city’s largest train station, a Jewish center, a movie theater and a hospital.

articles.headline: Food Prices Expected to Keep Going Up
articles.snippet: Consumers should not expect lower food prices anytime soon because the prices on most meat and packaged items are holding firm or even increasing.
articles.abstract: Consumers should not expect lower food prices anytime soon because the prices on most meat and packaged items are holding firm or even increasing.
articles.lead_paragraph: For more than a year, food manufacturers have been shaving package sizes and raising prices, declaring that they had little choice because of unprecedented increases in the cost of raw ingredients like corn, soybeans and wheat.

articles.headline: In Lean Times, Online Coupons Are Catching On
articles.snippet: The effort to find a deal in brick-and-mortar stores has moved online, where a rising world of coupon-clipping has taken shape.
articles.abstract: The effort to find a deal in brick-and-mortar stores has moved online, where a rising world of coupon-clipping has taken shape.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO  On the Internet, nothing travels faster than a tip on how to score a bargain. Especially in an economic downturn.

articles.headline: Grandma’s on the Computer Screen
articles.snippet: The Web cam adventures of the nursery school set and their grandparents offer a glimpse at what can be gained, and what may be lost, by almost-being there.
articles.abstract: The Web cam adventures of the nursery school set and their grandparents offer a glimpse at what can be gained, and what may be lost, by almost-being there.
articles.lead_paragraph: DEER PARK, N.Y.  Her grandfather wanted to play tea party, but Alexandra Geosits, 2½, insisted she had only apple juice. She held out a plastic cup, giggling as she waited to see if he would accept the substitute.

articles.headline: New Efforts for Stimulus in Europe and China
articles.snippet: China announced its largest interest rate cut in more than a decade, while the European Union outlined a $258 billion plan to spur growth on the Continent.
articles.abstract: China announced its largest interest rate cut in more than a decade, while the European Union outlined a $258 billion plan to spur growth on the Continent.
articles.lead_paragraph: Responding to rapidly deteriorating conditions in the global economy, China and Europe unleashed a spate of stimulus measures on Wednesday to battle the effects of an unrelenting downturn in growth.
articles.byline: By Keith Bradsher and Stephen Castle

articles.headline: U.S. Consumer Loan Aid Will Trickle Only So Far
articles.snippet: The federal government made two big moves to help consumers, but some are ineligible and others will have to wait months before the benefits come.
articles.abstract: The federal government made two big moves to help consumers, but some are ineligible and others will have to wait months before the benefits come.
articles.lead_paragraph: If you’re buying a home, refinancing a mortgage or seeking an auto or student loan, the new government plans to make borrowing cheaper and easier sound like a gift.
articles.byline: By Ron Lieber and Tara Siegel Bernard

articles.headline: Indian Commandos Storm Jewish Center
articles.snippet: It was not known how many hostages were being held inside Nariman House, home to the Orthodox Jewish group Chabad Lubavitch.
articles.abstract: It was not known how many hostages were being held inside Nariman House, home to the Orthodox Jewish group Chabad Lubavitch.
articles.lead_paragraph: MUMBAI, India — Indian commandos slid down ropes from a hovering army helicopter Friday morning as they stormed a Jewish community center that had been seized by terrorists during bloody and widespread attacks on Mumbai, India’s commercial capital.
articles.byline: By Somini Sengupta and Keith Bradsher

articles.headline: Iraq Backs Deal That Sets End of U.S. Role
articles.snippet: The Iraqi Parliament ratified an agreement that sets out a three-year timetable for withdrawal of U.S. forces from Iraq.
articles.abstract: The Iraqi Parliament ratified an agreement that sets out a three-year timetable for withdrawal of U.S. forces from Iraq.
articles.lead_paragraph: BAGHDAD  With a substantial majority, the Iraqi Parliament on Thursday ratified a sweeping security agreement that sets the course for an end to the United States’ role in the war and marks the beginning of a new relationship between the countries.
articles.byline: By ALISSA RUBIN and CAMPBELL ROBERTSON
